summary: This is an email chain regarding an update to a victim services website for the Jeffrey Epstein case. It announces a court hearing ordered in connection with the proposed nolle prosequi order following Epstein's death, scheduled for August 27, 2019, before Judge Richard M. Berman.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who ordered the hearing scheduled for August 27, 2019.

events.title: Proposed Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: The United States Attorney proposed a nolle prosequi order (declination to prosecute) to the Court following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Hearing on Victim Input
events.description: A hearing ordered by Judge Berman in connection with the proposed nolle prosequi order, where counsel for victims and victims themselves will be heard.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: A hearing was ordered on August 21, 2019, in the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein following the defendant's death.
The hearing is related to a nolle prosequi order proposed by the U.S. Attorney on August 19, 2019, which would formally drop the prosecution.
The hearing, scheduled for August 27, 2019, before Judge Richard M. Berman, is intended to allow victims and their counsel to be heard on the matter.
The email is a request to update a victim services website with this hearing information.
The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, though their name is not explicitly stated in the provided text.
